title: A new website for the Shadow Isles, and Full Lore for all of its champions has landed!
body:
Take a gander at the Shadow Isles in its full glory! Also if you missed Shadow and Fortune, read it here too!

Links for other regions:

EUW - http://euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/shadow-isles#/?_k=y5t8tb

OCE - http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/shadow-isles

Also there's a poem: "The Princeling's Lament": http://euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/shadow-isles#/the-princelings-lament?_k=matps2

Yorick's new lore is so good lol

Holy shit, Eve's got a lore (or at least part of one.)  She finally did it.  

Excited to read these, and the Princeling's Lament is interesting...seems to confirm that Karthus and Thresh would work together, despite Karthus' objections to Thresh's methods.  Certainly takes his sympathetic note down a notch.

I didn't find Evelynn's too surprising, sort of confirms what we've always suspected of her, she's an assassin, but it seems interesting that she isn't bound to the Mist at all, and doesn't seem to be interested in the same sorts of schemes as, say, Morde or Karthus.  I also like the brief cameo mention of Singed still being up to his usual tricks.  The one thing that struck me as odd is that the client's name is "Saito Takeda", which sounds super Ionian, if we're going by the usual Ionian characterization of "Mini-Runeterran-Asia", but he's Zaunite.

It seems we have an origin for the Blessed Isles now, and his name is Maokai.  I liked this one a lot.  Maokai's color text is also interesting, in that it uses a lot of blunt, short sentences, and it's in first person, so it does sound sort of like the way the Treant would talk.  It's simple, but I think that makes it work.

I'm really pleased with most of Elise's story.  Elise is smart, cunning, and devious, and she's got all those traits in spades.  Also, direct, canon confirmation of her ties to the Black Rose and LeBlanc will make a lot of people pleased.  The one aspect I don't like is the whole "I want to stay beautiful" trope, because I feel like it's a bit overused in fantasy stuff.  That kinda brought me out of it, but I do like that they kept a lot of her traits from old canon.  (Also, damn, you don't want to be a guy named "Marcus" or "Markus" in Noxus, nothing good comes of it.  Also the man made of spiders is some of the creepiest imagery League's ever had, holy shit riot.)


Yorick's new lore seems pretty similar at the beginning to Karthus' old one.  Making friends with the dead, being an outcast, etc.  I will miss the Mori Family stuff, as I always liked that, but his new story is good.  I also love that he constantly carries a cape that just sasses him.  Even Yorick's clothes make jokes about Yorick.

Overall it was all very somber and downbeat, which is, honestly, to be expected of the Shadow Isles, so I think that's alright.  I'm a fan, and I'm happy to see another set of champs get their updated stories.  Thanks, Narrative Team.

(This is just some venting I need to do.)

FYI, way too many Rioters kept telling me that there were elements of the Old Yorick in the New Yorick backstory and to hold off judgement on the rework.

Honestly, I feel like I was lied to in order to temper my disdain for this entire process.  (It didn't work)  I hated it from the gif teaser on Facebook and I hate it now that everything is revealed.

Old Yorick was a gravedigger who was forcibly resurrected in order to "fill his quota," seeing the League of Legends as a method to this.  This was the only "blue collar" character in a game of exemplars and paragons.

New Yorick is the Haley Joel Osment character from _Sixth Sense_ who grew up into a monk (which League already has 6 of if you count the ninjas), then becomes the Bruce Willis character from _Armageddon_ (must destroy the thing in order to save everyone).

So, yeah, I hate this rework and I really have no love for all the Rioters who lied to me about it (they know who they are).

As far as Evelynn goes, I get the feeling that Riot wants to remove the whole "sensation-seeking hedonist" part of her character and focus on her as an assassin and a demon-like creature.  I mean, if Miss Fortune isn't a flirt anymore, why should Evelynn remain a pleasure seeking creature?
As long as you can see the good things in this rework and not let yourself be victimized, you're free to think how you want about the rework. :)
